akas: O magikos kipos Greece (transliterated ISO-LATIN-1 title)
akas from release info: O magikos kipos Greece (transliterated ISO-LATIN-1 title)

1.title: Makka Pakka Washes Faces
1.plot: Makka Pakka visits all the inhabitants of the garden to wash their faces. Everyone in the garden loves to have their faces washed - even the teeny tiny Pontipines.

2.title: Tombliboos' Waving Game
2.plot: The Tombliboos discover the game of waving. They wave to everybody as they fly through the garden in the Pinky Ponk. Even the great big Haahoos wave back. The Tombliboo waving game makes everybody in the garden happy.

3.title: Everybody All Aboard the Ninky Nonk
3.plot: Everybody goes for a ride in the Ninky Nonk. Makka Pakka gets left behind. He chases the Ninky Nonk and everybody thinks he wants a ride, but all he wants is to give the Ninky Nonk a wash.

4.title: The Prettiest Flower
4.plot: Upsy Daisy wants to look at all the pretty flowers in the garden, but Igglepiggle wants to ride in the Ninky Nonk. They each go their separate ways, but when Igglepiggle finds the prettiest flower of all, he collects Upsy Daisy in the Ninky Nonk and takes her to see it.

5.title: Makka Pakka's Trumpet Makes a Funny Noise
5.plot: The Tombliboos are riding in the Pinky Ponk, enjoying their Pinky Ponk Juice. Each of them makes a different funny noise when they sip their juice. Despite the request from the Narrator to drink their Pinky Ponk Juice gently and quietly, the game continues until everyone in the garden can hear the funny noise coming from the Pinky Ponk.

6.title: Pontipines in Upsy Daisy's Bed
6.plot: The Pontipines count up to five. The Pontipines go for a very long walk around the garden. As they pass by Upsy Daisy's bed, the children suddenly disappear. Mr and Mrs look through the binoculars and find them asleep in Upsy Daisy's bed. Only Upsy Daisy is allowed to sleep in Upsy Daisy's bed - and here she comes! Wake up Pontipines!

7.title: Who's Next on the Pinky Ponk?
7.plot: The Tombliboos decide to ride in the Pinky Ponk, but it keeps landing to allow someone else to board. The fun is to guess who is getting on next from the clues out of the window. Finally, the teeny tiny Pontipines board - but they are so small that nobody notices them arrive. Everybody loves riding in the Pinky Ponk. Everybody joins in the dance at the gazebo.

8.title: Igglepiggle's Blanket in Makka Pakka's Ditch
8.plot: Igglepiggle has lost his blanket. Upsy Daisy helps him look for it. They hear the distant sound of Makka Pakka's trumpet call. The Gazebo shows them a picture of Makka Pakka, so they visit him and find Igglepiggle's blanket in Makka Pakka's ditch, blocking Makka Pakka's way. Makka Pakka is so pleased to be able to make his way out into the garden, that he washes Igglepiggle's and Upsy Daisy's faces on the spot.

9.title: The Ninky Nonk Wants a Kiss
9.plot: Upsy Daisy is kissing everything in the garden. She kisses a tree, a flower and Igglepiggle. She rides around the garden in the Ninky Nonk visiting and kissing people and things. Suddenly the Ninky Nonk stops and won't go. Upsy Daisy wonders why - then realises -the Ninky Nonk wants a kiss too!

10.title: Too Loud Tombliboos! Nice and Quiet
10.plot: The Tombliboos are inside their bush, happily practicing their music so loudly that it can be heard all over the garden. Everybody tries calling to the Tombliboos, but nobody can make themselves heard above the noise. What can be done to stop the terrible racket? The teeny tiny Pontipine children know just what to do.

11.title: Makka Pakka Gets Lost
11.plot: Makka Pakka sets off through the garden looking for stones to wash and tidy. He is so busy he loses his way - oh dear, which way is home? No need to worry - because here comes the Pinky Ponk. Makka Pakka follows the Pinky Ponk all the way home. Everybody joins in the dance at the gazebo.

12.title: Jumping for Everybody
12.plot: The Pontipines count to six. Upsy Daisy shows Igglepiggle how to jump. Soon everybody is joining in the jumping game - from the great big Haahoos to the teeny tiny Pontipines. Everybody joins in the dance at the gazebo.

13.title: Hiding in Flowerpots
13.plot: The Pontipines count to three. First the Tombliboos play hiding, then the Pontipines set off for a walk around the garden.

14.title: Pinky Ponk Adventure
14.plot: The Pinky Ponk gets stuck in a tree and tips up. Everybody slides up one end. They rock back and forth and tip the Pinky Ponk the other way. They slide up to the other end. The Pinky Ponk tips back and forth and everybody slides up and down, having great fun. At last the Pinky Ponk breaks free and flies off, taking everybody to the dance.

15.title: Tombliboos' Tower of Five
15.plot: The Pontipines are counting to five. Makka Pakka is building a pile of five stones. The Tombliboos are inside their bush, building with their very own bricks. Each Tombliboo is building a tower and when they begin to compare towers and share bricks, they succeed in building a very tall tower indeed - a tower of five. Everybody joins in the dance at the gazebo.

16.title: Igglepiggle's Mucky Patch
16.plot: Igglepiggle falls down flat and gets a muddy patch on his tummy. He gets the mud on his hand, on his blanket and on Upsy Daisy.

17.title: Funny Noises from the Pinky Ponk
17.plot: The Tombliboos are riding in the Pinky Ponk, enjoying their Pinky Ponk Juice. Each of them makes a different funny noise when they sip their juice.

18.title: Quiet Please Tombliboos, Upsy Daisy Wants to Sing
18.plot: Upsy Daisy sets up her own special megaphone to sing. Unfortunately, there is so much noise coming from the Tombliboo's house that she can't make herself heard. Finally, all is well when everyone sings together.

19.title: Tombliboos Clean Their Teeth
19.plot: The Tombliboos run all over the inside of their bush looking for their toothbrushes. They clean their teeth to the teeth cleaning song, then run out into the garden proudly to show everyone their clean teeth. Makka Pakka arrives to wash their faces - what lovely clean Tombliboos! Everybody joins in the dance at the gazebo.

20.title: Igglepiggle's Blanket Walks About by Itself
20.plot: Igglepiggle is enjoying dancing in the garden. He leaves his blanket in a safe place but when he returns, it is gone. Igglepiggle's blanket has landed on Makka Pakka and seems to be running about by itself.

21.title: Pontipine Children in the Tombliboos' Trousers
21.plot: The Pontipine children play in the Tombliboos' trousers.

22.title: Upsy Daisy's Big Loud Sing Song
22.plot: Upsy Daisy chooses to sing through her megaphone.

23.title: Playing Hiding with Makka Pakka
23.plot: The Tombliboos have discovered a new game: Hiding in the garden.

24.title: The Ball
24.plot: The ball bounces around the garden visiting one character after another.

25.title: Where Is the Pinky Ponk Going?
25.plot: Everyone in the Night Garden boards the Pinky Ponk for a very special journey.

26.title: Igglepiggle Looks for Upsy Daisy and Follows Her Bed
26.plot: Iggle Piggle drops his blanket, and then he can't find Upsy Daisy. He follows Upsy Daisy's bed, which leads him to where she is.

27.title: Wave to the Wottingers
27.plot: The Pontipines set out on their very long walk, but look at that - everywhere they go their next door neighbours, the Wottingers, are there before them. They wave to the Wottingers and the Wottingers wave back, all round the garden until they are all safely home again.

28.title: Runaway Og-Pog
28.plot: Makka Pakka's Og-Pog rolls right away. Everybody chases it all around the garden.

29.title: Upsy Daisy, Igglepiggle, the Bed & the Ball
29.plot: Upsy Daisy is asleep in her bed when the ball bounces into the garden.

30.title: Tombliboo Ooo Drinks Everybody Else's Pinky Ponk Juice
30.plot: Everyone is enjoying a ride on the Pinky Ponk.

31.title: Looking for Each Other
31.plot: Igglepiggle and Upsy Daisy are best friends, but today Igglepiggle can't find Upsy Daisy. He asks Makka Pakka. He asks the Tombliboos, until finally Upsy Daisy's bed leads him back to Upsy Daisy.

32.title: High and Low
32.plot: The Tombliboos explore inside their house. It is full of interesting spaces, stairs to climb and slides to slide down. Today they go right to the top of their house - each one higher than the next - but down below Makka Pakka is waiting to wash their faces so they must come all the way down again.

33.title: Tombliboos Have a Very Busy Day
33.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

34.title: The Pontipines on the Ninky Nonk
34.plot: Everyone goes for a ride on the Ninky Nonk, but the teeny tiny Pontipines are left behind. They chase the Ninky Nonk all around the garden until they finally catch it and secretly ride in their own special carriage.

35.title: The Pontipines Find Igglepiggle's Blanket
35.plot: Igglepiggle is dancing in the garden when he loses his blanket. It has fallen on top of the teeny tiny Pontipine house. What are the little Pontipines to do? Mr Pontipine repeatedly rings Igglepiggle on the Trubliphone until, at last, Igglepiggle comes to where the blanket has fallen. Igglepiggle is thrilled to have his blanket back, the Pontipines can see out of the window again and everyone is happy.

36.title: Igglepiggle's Accident
36.plot: Igglepiggle discovers the stones, which Makka Pakka has most carefully tidied into a special pattern. Dancing on his way, Igglepiggle accidentally knocks over the stones. He tries to put them back as they were, but somehow they are never quite right. Makka Pakka returns and cheerfully restores the stones to perfect order.

37.title: Upsy Daisy Kisses Everything
37.plot: Upsy Daisy loves the garden so much; she frequently happily kisses everything around her. Today, when she kisses a flower, the bridge, a tree - magical things happen. The bridge plays music, the flower grows, the tree sheds beautiful blossom.

38.title: Following
38.plot: The Tombliboos are playing inside their house, but Tombliboo Eee cannot decide what to do. She doesn't want to play with the drums like Tombliboo Unn. She doesn't want to play with the bricks like Tombliboo Ooo. Tombliboo Eee wanted to play the piano - soon all the Tombliboos are playing happily together following each other.

39.title: Look What the Ball Did!
39.plot: The ball is bouncing all over the garden. It accidentally knocks over Makka Pakka's pile of stones and bounces happily away. Makka Pakka rebuilds his stones and protects them from the bouncing ball only for the ball to accidentally knock him over too. The ball is always a lot of fun.

40.title: The Tombliboos Build an Arch
40.plot: The Pontipines are out for a walk in the garden when the children stay behind in the pile of stones. Inside the Tombliboo house the Tombliboos build an arch out of their bricks. The Pontipine children make an arch out of the stones. All play going under and through.

41.title: Makka Pakka's Stone Garden
41.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

42.title: Hurry Up Tombliboos
42.plot: The Tombliboos are in their house when Makka Pakka comes to call. In their haste to leave, Tombliboo Eee keeps going the wrong way. Finally, they discover that they can find their way together.

43.title: Wake Up Igglepiggle
43.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

44.title: Washing the Haahoos
44.plot: The smallest Pontipines and the biggest Haahoos are all clean when Makka Pakka washes their faces. But the Tombliboos are especially clean, because they also have great fun cleaning their teeth.

45.title: Where's Upsy Daisy Gone?
45.plot: Upsy Daisy teaches Igglepiggle how to play hiding. Upsy Daisy is very good at hiding. Igglepiggle is impressed.

46.title: Over and Under
46.plot: Everyone is riding on the Pinky Ponk when the Ding Dong alarm goes. The Pinky Ponk goes up, up and over and down, down and under. Everyone has a very adventurous ride.

47.title: Upsy Daisy's Tiring Walk
47.plot: Igglepiggle and Upsy Daisy go for a very long walk. Feeling tired, they decide to go by Ninky Nonk. They have a very bouncy ride.

48.title: Makka Pakka's Present
48.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

49.title: Igglepiggle Goes Visiting
49.plot: Igglepiggle visits everyone in the garden and they each offer him a special thing. All except the teeny tiny Pontipines. Igglepiggle can't find the Pontipines because they are so very small.

50.title: Tombliboo Trousers
50.plot: The Tombliboos are having fun in the garden, but whatever they do, their trousers keep on falling down.

51.title: Where's Your Uff-Uff Makka Pakka?
51.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

52.title: Dinner in the Ninky Nonk
52.plot: The Pontipines decide to have their dinner on the Ninky Nonk. The inevitable bouncy ride has comic consequences as they travel upside down along the branches and all round the garden.

53.title: Igglepiggle's Tiddle
53.plot: A mysterious jet of water, a tiddle, appears suddenly next to Igglepiggle. He discovers that he can control it by stamping his feet. Delighted, he takes it to Makka Pakka who finds it very useful indeed.

54.title: Tombliboo Eee Gets Lost
54.plot: Tombliboo Eee becomes separated from the other two Tombliboos, Unn and Ooo. They wander all over the garden looking for each other until Tombliboo Eee meets Upsy Daisy and her megaphone and the problem is resolved.

55.title: Shshsh! Upsy Daisy's Having a Rest!
55.plot: Upsy Daisy simply wants to rest in her bed but is disturbed by one character after another. Finally, Upsy Daisy is left alone but discovers that she would much rather play with her friends after all.

56.title: Slow Down Everybody
56.plot: The Tombliboos are playing their music so fast that everybody does everything very fast. Igglepiggle and Upsy Daisy dance, and Makka Pakka washes stones until at last, the Tombliboos slow down.

57.title: Be Careful Tombliboos!
57.plot: Travelling in the Pinky Ponk, the Tombliboos are drinking their Pinky Ponk juice. Several times they just avoid spilling their juice by being careful but finally it splats everywhere.

58.title: Igglepiggle's Noisy Noises
58.plot: Everything in the garden is so noisy that Igglepiggle moves away to find a quiet place to be by himself. Once there, he misses all his friends until Upsy Daisy comes to find him.

59.title: The Pontipine Children on the Roof
59.plot: The Pontipines are riding on the Ninky Nonk but Mr. and Mrs. Pontipine can't find the children. Those naughty dollies are riding on the roof of the Pontipine carriage!

60.title: Upsy Daisy Dances with the Pinky Ponk
60.plot: Upsy Daisy shows her love for everything in the garden by dancing. Here she dances with the Pinky Ponk. The Pinky Ponk imitates her every move as they create a happy pas de deux.

61.title: The Tombliboos Swap Trousers
61.plot: The Tombliboos trousers get mixed up all over the place-in the Ninky Nonk, in the Pinky Ponk. No matter how often the Tombliboos change their trousers back-it happens all over again!

62.title: Kicking the Ball
62.plot: Upsy Daisy is the best at kicking the ball. Igglepiggle finds it harder so she kindly teaches him-try again Igglepiggle. At last Igglepiggle does the best kick of all-all around the garden.

63.title: Where Are the Tombliboos' Toothbrushes?
63.plot: Everything is getting lost. The Pontipine children are nowhere to be found and the Tombliboos' toothbrushes just won't stay put. Eventually the Tombliboos catch up with their toothbrushes and give their teeth a really good clean.

64.title: The Pontipines' Picnic
64.plot: The Pontipines are looking for the perfect place to have a picnic. They try the stones, the log, the pebbles and then they try the branch-perfect! The Pontipines call the Wottingers on the Trubliphone and invite them to the picnic. The Wottingers had better get there quick else the Pontipines might eat all the food! Everybody joins in the dance at the Gazebo.

65.title: Upsy Daisy's Funny Bed
65.plot: After waking Upsy Daisy, Igglepiggle goes with her for a walk in the garden. Upsy Daisy's bed decides to follow them-even when they ride on the Ninky Nonk! When Upsy Daisy decides she would like a rest, her bed makes her chase after it-what a funny bed!

66.title: Upsy Daisy's Special Stone
66.plot: Upsy Daisy gives her special stone to Igglepiggle to look after whilst she rides the Ninky Nonk. Igglepiggle starts to play with the ball and forgets all about Upsy Daisy's stone! Makka Pakka finds the stone and gives it back to Igglepiggle so that he can give it back to Upsy Daisy-just in time.

67.title: Makka Pakka's Piles of Three
67.plot: The Tombliboos are indoors playing with their bricks. They decide to make three towers-make sure they are all the same Tombliboos! Makka Pakka is making piles of stones, but he needs another one to make three piles of three stones. Here comes Upsy Daisy and she has a present for Makka Pakka, a stone which she found in her bed. Now Makka Pakka can complete his piles of three stones.

68.title: Running About
68.plot: Everybody is running about in the garden so much that Makka Pakka can't wash faces. After a lot of fun and chasing, they all come together and Makka Pakka succeeds in his task.

69.title: Trousers on the Ninky Nonk
69.plot: The Tombliboos and Makka Pakka take a ride on the Ninky Nonk. What a Bumpy Ride! Hold onto your trousers Tombliboos! The Tombliboos trousers fly off and whiz around the Ninky Nonk. The Tombliboos forget their trousers and leave them on the Ninky Nonk. The Tombliboos have to go home without their trousers! Here come Makka Pakka and he's got a present for the Tombliboos.

70.title: Where Are the Wottingers?
70.plot: After having their faces washed by Makka Pakka, the Pontipines go to meet the Wottingers. The Wottingers are not in, where could they be? The Pontipines go looking for them around the garden. Here comes the Ninky Nonk, who's riding on the Ninky Nonk? Everybody joins in the dance at the Gazebo.

71.title: Windy Day in the Garden
71.plot: Upsy Daisy and Igglepiggle are going for a walk in the garden; it is a very windy day. The trees are blowing side to side. Igglepiggle's blanket gets blown up and up into the air, where will it land-look out Upsy Daisy! The Tombliboos are outside their house and now their trousers have been blown off the line! All round the garden and onto the roof of their house. Here comes the Pinky Ponk maybe it can help get their trousers back.

72.title: Tombliboo Ooo Brings the Ball Indoors
72.plot: The Tombliboos are playing inside when they hear something outdoors, it's the ball. Ooo collects the ball and brings it inside. The Tombliboos play with the ball indoors until it flies out the window. Look out Makka Pakka! Makka Pakka loves the ball.

73.title: What a Funny Ninky Nonk
73.plot: The Tombliboos take a ride on the Ninky Nonk; it goes past Igglepiggle, then Upsy Daisy and then Makka Pakka. It goes up and down the trees and round and round the branches. Everybody tries to catch the Ninky Nonk even the teeny tiny Pontipines. At last everyone can get on board for a Ninky Nonk ride with the Tombliboos.

74.title: Mr. Pontipine's Moustache Flies Away
74.plot: The Pontipines count to three. The Pontipines are eating their Pontipine dinner when Mr Pontipine's moustache flies off! First it gets stuck on the chimney, then the bridge and then the Gazebo! Quick, follow the moustache Pontipines. Mr Pontipine's moustache eventually ends up stuck to the Pinky Ponk's propeller, it blows the moustache back towards the Pontipines. Watch out Mrs Pontipine! Everybody joins in the dance at the Gazebo.

75.title: Make Up Your Mind Upsy Daisy
75.plot: Upsy Daisy is singing in the garden when the ball bounces along and comes to a rest beside her. Upsy Daisy can't make up her mind whether to sing or play with the ball. Here comes the Ninky Nonk and now here comes the Pinky Ponk. Upsy Daisy can't make up her mind whether to ride the Ninky Nonk or the Pinky Ponk! Igglepiggle finds Upsy Daisy and then she knows what to do. She makes up her mind to go for a walk with Igglepiggle.

76.title: Catch the Ninky Nonk, Tombliboos
76.plot: Makka Pakka takes a ride on the Ninky Nonk. The Tombliboos are playing inside their house when the Ninky Nonk stops outside. They decide to join Makka Pakka on the Ninky Nonk. Oh dear, the Ninky Nonk has left without them, catch the Ninky Nonk Tombliboos! The Tombliboos take a ride on the Pinky Ponk to help them catch the Ninky Nonk.

77.title: Hide-and-Seek
77.plot: The Pontipines are playing a game of hide and seek with the Wottingers. The Pontipines hide whilst the Wottingers count. The Pontipine children keep changing their hiding places until they all end up in Upsy Daisy's bed! Only Upsy Daisy is allowed in Upsy Daisy's bed-and here she comes!

78.title: What Loud Music, Tombliboos!
78.plot: Igglepiggle discovers musical stepping stones. The Tombliboos hear Igglepiggle's stones and then they hear Upsy Daisy singing. What lovely music. The Tombliboos go home and play music as well-very loudly! Makka Pakka must use his trumpet through Upsy Daisy's megaphone before the Tombliboos can hear him.

79.title: Where Can Igglepiggle Have a Rest
79.plot: Upsy Daisy is riding in the Pinky Ponk when she sees her bed. She gets off the Pinky Ponk and decides to have a rest in her bed. Igglepiggle is trying to find somewhere soft to have a rest. Upsy Daisy gets up after her rest and goes for a walk. Igglepiggle then gets into Upsy Daisy's bed. Only Upsy Daisy is allowed to sleep in Upsy Daisy's bed-Upsy Daisy's coming back! Out jumps Igglepiggle and off they chase-what fun. Igglepiggle and Upsy Daisy are best friends.

80.title: Waving from the Ninky Nonk
80.plot: Igglepiggle is taking a ride on the Ninky Nonk; Upsy Daisy then gets on, she and Igglepiggle wave to each other from their different carriages. The Ninky Nonk travels around the garden and soon everybody is on board. The Tombliboos and Makka Pakka wave to Upsy Daisy and Igglepiggle. Even the teeny tiny Pontipines are waving to their neighbours the Wottingers. Everybody loves waving.

81.title: Where Did Makka Pakka's Sponge Go?
81.plot: Makka Pakka is walking in the garden when he comes across some stones which he decides to clean. Mind the small stone Makka Pakka, woops! Makka Pakka trips over a stone and his sponge flies off straight into Upsy Daisy's megaphone, what a funny noise! Now how is Makka Pakka going to get his sponge back?

82.title: Ninky Nonk Dinner Swap
82.plot: The Pontipines are taking their dinner for a walk in the garden. Here comes the Ninky Nonk. The Pontipines take their dinner aboard the Ninky Nonk. What a lovely dinner delicious food for Mr and Mrs Pontipine and runny grobbles for the children. The Ninky Nonk takes the Pontipines for a ride round the garden, what a bouncy ride! When the Ninky Nonk comes to a stop the Pontipines dinner has swapped over, runny grobbles for Mr and Mrs Pontipine and all kinds of delicious food for the children. Everybody joins in the dance at the Gazebo.

83.title: Trubliphone Fun
83.plot: The Pontipines are out for a walk in the garden when they hear a lot of loud noises. Upsy Daisy is singing, Makka Pakka is stacking stones and the Tombliboos are playing their Tombliboo music! Meanwhile, Igglepiggle is out for a long walk, skipping through the garden. He goes so far that he gets lost! The Pontipines call everybody on the Trubliphone. Make even more noise everybody! Igglepiggle follows the noisy noises to find his friends again.

84.title: Makka Pakka's Circle of Friends
84.plot: Makka Pakka is in the garden looking for stones but he can't find any anywhere! Igglepiggle is walking in the garden and comes across a stone, he decides to find Makka Pakka and give the stone to him. Upsy Daisy finds a stone and gives it to Makka Pakka then the Tombliboos find 1-2-3 stones and give them all to Makka Pakka. Makka Pakka's friends have given him 5 stones! Here come the teeny tiny Pontipines and they're carrying a stone for Makka Pakka. Makka Pakka now has six stones! What lovely friends.

85.title: Long and Ponky Ride on the Pinky Ponk
85.plot: The Tombliboos are taking a ride on the Pinky Ponk. Mind the tree Pinky Ponk. 'Ponk'! What a big ponk! Igglepiggle and Upsy Daisy join the Tombliboos for a ride on the Pinky Ponk. Watch out for the Tombliboo bush Pinky Ponk. 'Ponk'! Another big ponk! Makka Pakka is waving to all his friends in the Pinky Ponk. Watch out for the Gazebo Pinky Ponk. 'Ponk'! 'Ponk'! 'Ponk'! What a ponky ride!

86.title: Sad and Happy Tombliboos
86.plot: Tombliboo Ooo is building a tower of bricks. Here comes Tombliboo Eee, she spots her favourite brick in Ooo's tower. Be careful Tombliboo Eee! She knocks over Ooo's tower trying to get her brick. Ooo is upset about his tower and starts to play sad music on the Tombliboo piano. Ooo's sad music makes Eee and Unn sad as well so they join. The Tombliboo's sad music makes everybody else in the garden sad. Tombliboo Unn decides to start playing the Tombliboo drums. What happy drumming. The Tombliboos begin to play happy music which makes everyone happy again.

87.title: Upsy Daisy Dances with the Pontipines
87.plot: Upsy Daisy is having a Dancy Day in the garden. First she dances with the Tombliboos. Then she dances with the Pontipines. Who's this riding on the Pinky Ponk, its Igglepiggle! Igglepiggle and Upsy Daisy dance together before everybody joins in the dance at the Gazebo.

88.title: Mind the Haahoos
88.plot: The Pontipines and the Wottingers are out for a walk in the garden. Mrs Pontipine spots something through her binoculars, it's the Ninky Nonk! All aboard the Ninky Nonk! Makka Pakka, Upsy Daisy and Igglepiggle all join the Pontipines and Wottingers for a ride on the Ninky Nonk. What a bouncy ride! Mind the Haahoos Ninky Nonk! What a clever Ninky Nonk.

89.title: Wake Up Ball
89.plot: What's that noise? It's the ball! The ball is bouncing through the garden and lands straight on Upsy Daisy's bed! The bed carries the ball all the way to Upsy Daisy. Upsy Daisy tucks the ball in so it can have a rest. The Tombliboos want to play with the ball but Upsy Daisy won't let them because she thinks it's tired. Who's here? It's Igglepiggle! Igglepiggle takes the ball and everybody chases him through the garden. Everybody loves to play with the ball and they all join in the dance at the Gazebo.

90.title: Upsy Daisy Forgets Her Stone
90.plot: Makka Pakka has a pile of six stones. He gives one stone to Igglepiggle and one stone to Upsy Daisy. Upsy Daisy tucks her stone safely in her bed. Makka Pakka gives a stone to each of the Tombliboos. What's that noise? It's the teeny tiny Pontipines and they've taken Makka Pakka's last stone! Upsy Daisy is tired and sits down on her bed for a rest. What's that? A stone! Upsy Daisy had forgotten all about the stone Makka Pakka had given her. Once she finds it she gives it back to him. Now Makka Pakka has a stone again, what a lovely present!

91.title: Long Distance Ball Game
91.plot: Upsy Daisy and Igglepiggle are out in the garden together. What's that sound? The ball! Upsy Daisy kicks the ball to Igglepiggle, what a big kick! Makka Pakka is riding in the Pinky Ponk, look out for the ball Makka Pakka! Igglepiggle throws the ball back to Upsy Daisy, what a big throw! The Tombliboo's are playing Tombliboo music in their Tombliboo bush, look out for the ball Tombliboo's! Upsy Daisy kicks the ball again and it's heading straight for the Pontipines house, look out teeny tiny Pontipines! Look out everybody!

92.title: The Wottingers' Hiding Game
92.plot: The Pontipines are playing hide and seek with the Wottingers. The Wottingers are walking through the garden looking for places to hide whilst the Pontipines count. The teeny tiny Pontipines manage to find all of the teeny tiny Wottingers, what a clever game! What is that sound? It's the Ninky Nonk! The Pontipines and the Wottingers ride in the Ninky Nonk all the way home. Everybody joins in the dance at the Gazebo.

93.title: Upsy Daisy Only Wants to Sing
93.plot: Upsy Daisy is singing with her megaphone in the garden. Here comes Upsy Daisy's bed. Upsy Daisy isn't tired though and sends her bed away. Makka Pakka wants to wash Upsy Daisy's face and Igglepiggle wants to play with Upsy Daisy but Upsy Daisy only wants to sing. What lovely singing Upsy Daisy. After her song Makka Pakka comes back and washes her face and then she plays with Igglepiggle. What a busy day, Upsy Daisy needs a rest and here comes Upsy Daisy's bed!

94.title: The Tombliboos' Busy Ninky Nonk Day
94.plot: The Tombliboos are riding on the Ninky Nonk what a bouncy ride. The Ninky Nonk stops in some very lovely parts of the garden and now the Ninky Nonk has stopped again. What's that sound? The ball! The Tombliboos chase after the ball. Hurry up Tombliboos the Ninky Nonk is getting ready to go! The Ninky Nonk sets off without the Tombliboos! Catch the Ninky Nonk! The Ninky Nonk leads the Tombliboos home and here comes the ball to play with the Tombliboos!

95.title: Pinky Ponk and the Ball
95.plot: Upsy Daisy, Makka Pakka, the Tombliboos and Igglepiggle are all going for a ride on the Pinky Ponk. The ball is bouncing through the garden, what a big bounce! The ball bounces up and hits the Pinky Ponk sending everyone sliding from one end to the other. Now the Pontipines are playing with the ball, what a big throw Pontipines. Look out everybody! The ball hits the Pinky Ponk several times making it fly in lots of silly ways. What a silly Pinky Ponk!

96.title: Sneezing
96.plot: Igglepiggle is skipping through the garden. Suddenly he lets out a very big sneeze! Don't worry Igglepiggle it's only a sneeze. Here comes Upsy Daisy, Igglepiggle is still sneezing and now Upsy Daisy does a big sneeze! The Tombliboos are hiding in the garden when suddenly there are one, two, three big sneezes and out pop the Tombliboos from behind the little round bush. Makka Pakka is tidying his stones when he lets out such a big sneeze that it makes the Pinky Ponk ponk into a tree! Bless you Makka Pakka! Everybody joins in the dance at the Gazebo.

97.title: Ninky Nonk or Pinky Ponk
97.plot: Igglepiggle, Upsy Daisy, Makka Pakka and the teeny tiny Pontipines all decide to go for a ride on the Ninky Nonk but the Tombliboos decide to ride in the Pinky Ponk instead. They watch from the window as the Ninky Nonk takes all their friends for a very bouncy ride-what a silly Ninky Nonk! The Tombliboos are pleased to be on the Pinky Ponk, but then the ponk alarm goes off. The Pinky Ponk ponks into a tree and then into the Gazebo several times-what a silly Pinky Ponk! After such a "ponky" ride, the Tombliboos decide to ride on the Ninky Nonk with all their friends ...

98.title: Oh Look! It's the Wottingers!
98.plot: The Wottingers are calling on the Pontipines, no reply, so they decide to go looking for them. The Pontipines were in after all and now the Pontipines go looking for the Wottingers! The Wottingers can't find the Pontipines anywhere and the Pontipines can't find the Wottingers! What's that sound? It's the Ninky Nonk! The Pontipines take a ride on the Ninky Nonk. Who's that in the teeny tiny hole? It's the Wottingers! Wave to the Wottingers!

99.title: Upsy Daisy Dances with the Haahoos
99.plot: Upsy Daisy is having a Dancy Day in the garden. First she dances with the Haahoos. Then she dances with the ball and then with the daisy's in the garden. What lovely dancing Upsy Daisy. Who's this riding in the Pinky Ponk, its Igglepiggle! Upsy Daisy dances with Igglepiggle and the Pinky Ponk. Everybody joins in the dance at the Gazebo.

100.title: Fall Down Ball
100.plot: The Tombliboos are out in the garden and here comes the ball, what a bouncy ball! The Tombliboos don't want to play with the ball. They want to play with their bricks indoors. The Tombliboos build a very tall tower. What's that sound? The ball! The ball bounces into the Tombliboo bush and knocks over the Tombliboos tower of bricks. The Tombliboos then build an arch out of all their bricks. The ball bounces into the Tombliboo bush again and this time knocks over the Tombliboos arch! Everybody joins in the dance at the Gazebo.

1.title: Pontipine Children in the Tombliboos' Trousers
1.plot: The Pontipines go for a very long walk. When they reach the Tombliboo house, the Pontipine children play a game of jumping in the Tombliboos' trousers. Mr and Mrs Pontipine have to go home without the children again.

3.title: Playing Hiding with Makka Pakka
3.plot: The Tombliboos have discovered a new game-hiding in the garden. Where have the Tombliboos gone? Makka Pakka arrives with his Og-Pog. He blows his trumpet and there are the Tombliboos running out from behind the bush to have their faces washed.

13.title: The Tombliboos' Busy Day
13.plot: The Tombliboos have a very busy day. First they ride on the Pinky Ponk, then they explore the garden and finally, they return to their house to clean their teeth before bedtime.

14.title: The Pontipines on the Ninky Nonk
14.plot: Everyone goes for a ride on the Ninky Nonk, but the teeny tiny Pontipines are left behind. They chase the Ninky Nonk all around the garden until they finally catch it and secretly ride in their own special carriage.

1.title: Makka Pakka's Stone Concert
1.plot: Makka Pakka discovers he can make musical notes by tapping different stones. He makes up a tune. Everyone hears it and comes to listen to Makka Pakka's stone concert.

3.title: Wake up Iggle Piggle!
3.plot: Igglepiggle tucks himself up in Upsy Daisy's bed. When Upsy Daisy comes back, he has to jump out quickly because, even though Igglepiggle and Upsy Daisy are best friends, only Upsy Daisy is allowed to sleep in Upsy Daisy's bed.

8.title: Makka Pakka's Present
8.plot: Makka Pakka makes a pile of six stones. One by one he gives everyone in the garden a stone for a present. He is left with one-a special stone for Makka Pakka.

11.title: Where's Your Uff-Uff Makka Pakka?
11.plot: Makka Pakka is washing the ball when his Uff-uff blows right away. It falls into Upsy Daisy's bed. She carefully retrieves it and sets off through the garden to return it to Makka Pakka.

18.title: What Loud Music, Tombliboos!
18.plot: Igglepiggle discovers musical stepping stones. The Tombliboos hear Igglepiggle's stones and then they hear Upsy Daisy singing. What lovely music. The Tombliboos go home and play music as well - very loudly!

3.title: Trubliphone Fun
3.plot: The Pontipines are out for a walk in the garden when they hear a lot of loud noises. Upsy Daisy is singing, Makka Pakka is stacking stones and the Tombliboos are playing their Tombliboo music!

9.title: Wake Up Ball
9.plot: What's that noise? It's the ball! The ball is bouncing through the garden and lands straight on Upsy Daisy's bed! The bed carries the ball all the way to Upsy Daisy. Upsy Daisy tucks the ball in so it can have a rest.

-1.title: Igglepiggle's Noisy Day
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.plot outline: A toddler/infant adventure garden which tip-toes between the twilight state of a child being awake and moving through to a state of sleep. It is somewhat psychedelic, yet to a child it is fun, imaginative, colourful and, as the programme comes to a close, relaxing and sweet.
imdb.title: In the Night Garden...
plot: A toddler/infant adventure garden which tip-toes between the twilight state of a child being awake and moving through to a state of sleep. It is somewhat psychedelic, yet to a child it is fun, imaginative, colourful and, as the programme comes to a close, relaxing and sweet.::Dean Mark Anthony
